subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 899
msgSnippet: ... I can assure you that many thousands of us run junit every day with no VAJ. You can download junit.zip from junit.org. Unzip this into a directory. Ensure
messageBody:
> I tried your suggestion but it still doesn't run. inVAJava() checks
> for Class.forName("com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport"); and since this
> class has to be linked with another ibm java class, it throws the
> same LinkageError: java.jang.UnsatistiedLinkError:no uvmtools in
> java.library.path

I can assure you that many thousands of us run junit every day with no VAJ.

You can download junit.zip from junit.org.

Unzip this into a directory.

Ensure that the junit.jar file you just unzipped is on your classpath BEFORE
any VAJ directories.

run

java -cp /path/to/junit.jar;%CLASSPATH% junit.ui.TestRunner

All will be well. The inVAJava() is used for weird classloading purposes,
not for any 'security' reason. I'm not sure its even in the codebase any
more.

A.

alan @ twelve71 . com
afrancis @ thoughtworks . com

agile is not a synonym for good
